intro: Sparganium gramineum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bur-reed, is a herbaceous wetland plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces cylindrical, spike-like clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, often in marshes or along the edges of ponds. Sparganium gramineum is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
